intro: Pimpinella koelzii, commonly known as the Koelz's cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, parsley-like scent. Pimpinella koelzii is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
